For it is not easy to succeed in making an arbitrator angry with the right party, if you yourself seem to treat the affair with indifference ; or in making him hate the right party, unless he first sees you on fire with hatred yourself3 nor will he be prompted to com- passion, unless you have shown him the tokens of your own grief by word, sentiment, tone of voice, look and even by loud lamentation. For just as there is no substance so ready to take fire, as to be capable of generating flame without the application of a spark, so also there is no mind so ready to absorb an orator’s influence, as to be inflammable when the assailing speaker is not himself aglow with passion.
